com.joliciel.talismane

Class AnnotatedText

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.AnnotatedText
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RawTextProcessor, Sentence

    public class AnnotatedText
extends java.lang.Object
    Text with related annotations, and observers when annotations are added.
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnnotatedText(java.lang.CharSequence text)
      Construct an annotated text with no annotations, and analysis start at text start, and analysis end text end.
      AnnotatedText(java.lang.CharSequence text, int analysisStart, int analysisEnd)
      Construct an annotated text with an explicit analysis start and end.
      AnnotatedText(java.lang.CharSequence text, int analysisStart, int analysisEnd, java.util.List<Annotation<?>> annotations)
      Construct an annotated text with an explicit analysis end and an initial list of annotations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T extends java.io.Serializable>
      void      		 addAnnotations(java.util.List<Annotation<T>> annotations)
      Add annotations to the current text.
      void addObserver(AnnotationObserver observer)
      Add an observer to be notified of annotation events.
      int getAnalysisEnd()
      The point in the text beyond which no more annotations should begin.
      More specifically, Annotation.getStart() < analysisEnd.
      This is useful when the annotator needs more context, but must only add annotations in a particular part of the text.
      int getAnalysisStart()
      The point in the text beyond which annotations can begin.
      More specifically, Annotation.getStart() <= analysisStart.
      java.util.List<Annotation<?>> getAnnotations()
      Immutable List of annotations ordered in natural order for the spans, and original order if spans are equal.
      <T extends java.io.Serializable>
      java.util.List<Annotation<T>>      		 getAnnotations(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Return all annotations of a particular type.
      java.lang.CharSequence getText()
      Text to which annotations have been applied.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public final java.lang.CharSequence getText()
        Text to which annotations have been applied.

      • getAnnotations

        public java.util.List<Annotation<?>> getAnnotations()
        Immutable List of annotations ordered in natural order for the spans, and original order if spans are equal.

      • getAnalysisStart

        public int getAnalysisStart()
        The point in the text beyond which annotations can begin.
        More specifically, Annotation.getStart() <= analysisStart.
        This is useful when the annotator needs more context, but must only add annotations in a particular part of the text.

      • getAnalysisEnd

        public int getAnalysisEnd()
        The point in the text beyond which no more annotations should begin.
        More specifically, Annotation.getStart() < analysisEnd.
        This is useful when the annotator needs more context, but must only add annotations in a particular part of the text.

      • addAnnotations

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> void addAnnotations(java.util.List<Annotation<T>> annotations)
        Add annotations to the current text.
        Parameters:
        annotations -

        public void addObserver(AnnotationObserver observer)
        Add an observer to be notified of annotation events.

      • getAnnotations

        public <T extends java.io.Serializable> java.util.List<Annotation<T>> getAnnotations(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Return all annotations of a particular type.
